The second results when the first one experiences three bit errors (first, second, and sixth bits). Such an error pattern cannot be detected by our coding strategy, but such multiple error patterns are very unlikely to occur. Our receiver uses the principle of maximum probability: An error-free transmission is much more likely enough.smallis e pprobability error -bitthe if errors three with one than Exercise6.28.3bit -triplea than occur to likely more is error bit -singlea that so be e pmust small How error?6.29 Error-Correcting Codes: HammingCodescreativecommon http://(License International 4.0 ShareAlike -CommonsCreative under Available

If we obtain unique answers, we are done; if two or more error patterns yield the same result, we can try double-bit error patterns. In our case, single-bit error patterns give a uniqueresult.
